page.title: 12HAMILTON HALL
page.content: When Hamilton Hall was built in 1894, it was the largest hotel in St.Andrews and was named the Grand Hotel. In 1949, it was bought by the University as a students' residence. Used first for men, then for women, it is now mixed. There are places for 112 students in Hall and 19 in an annex at Edencourt in City Road. During the academic year 1984-85, it housed 56 men and 73 women students. The balance of men and women students varies from year to year. Priority is given to 4th students in their Senior Honours Year,followed by 1st Year students for whom about 50% of places are reserved.The fees, per Year, are Â£953 for a single room and Â£858 for a shared room. This includes three meals a day except on Saturdays and Sundays when there is no evening meal. During vacations it is used for conferences.
